Levels.s__9: Presentation of the payoff for both options.
Levels.s_10: Presentation of the probability for both options.
Levels.s_20: Beginning of the waiting time for the result.

good.Description: trials correctly presented on the screen {0,1}

a.Description: ambiguity area as a proportion of the bar [0 0.8]

bias.Description: Bias in the actual division of the option behind the mask: 0 indicates the left extreme, 0.5 in the middle of the mask, and 1 on the right extreme.

p.Description: Actual probability [0 1] of the left option, the right option takes the value of (1-p).

pv.Description: Visible probability [0 1] of the left option, that is, witho take into the accout the hidden area (a). [ pv*(1-a) + (1-pv)*(1-a) + a = 1 ] and  [pv*(1-a) + (bias)*a = p ]. The right option takes the value of (1-pv).

TMSips.Description: if eeg/TMS session, a dummy variable [0 1] indicating TMS over intraparietal sulcus

TMSppc.Description: in eeg/TMS session, a dummy variable [0 1] indicating TMS over posterior parietal cortex

TMSvertex.Description: in eeg/TMS session, a dummy variable [0 1] indicating TMS over vertex

delta.Description: in the eeg sessions, indicate de discrepanci between the time in the computer of stimuli presentation and the reading of the code in the eeg recording computer

fixed.Description: in the eeg sessions, a dummy variable [0 1] indicating that the stimuli code was lost in the eeg recording but was recovery from the coputer of the stimuli presentation
